column1: Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) is a test to examine the lining of the esophagus, stomach, and first part of the small intestine.
EGD is done with an endoscope.
Air was put through the endoscope to make it easier for the doctor to see.
If you had a polyp removed, your provider may ask you to avoid lifting and other activities for up to 1 week.
